data.title: (Fixed in bleed 2015-05-29) Debug menu and Options show only Debug menu
data.body:
In bleed 2015-03-24 TS you can't get options menu up in game.

Pressing "Debug menu cog" or "SHIFT+ESC" show Debug menu
Pressing "Options cog" or "ESC" show Debug menu
![openra game_2015_03_24_14_38_09_810](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/6802854/ea1344cc-d233-11e4-929f-b7ecf0213ee9.png)
![openra game_2015_03_24_14_38_14_162](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/6802866/f76535ae-d233-11e4-86dd-2faabb86e176.png)

data.title: Forgot how to create Windows Server
data.body: About 5-8 months ago, I had two-three games goin for about a week for friends. Forgot how to do it, I remember I was referring to a Wiki that actually had some information about Windows but all was replaced with only Linux? I recall having to take a Shortcut adding parameters in the target field, that was the configuration, later turned it into a service, another theory is that commands we're changed? https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Dedicated Thanks! Will contribute to documentation when I setup server :) --- I know once I am able to figure out the issue with the crash (exception.log & graphics.log commented below). The server will work.

data.title: Batch shroud cell changes
data.body:
Significantly improves the perf issue noted in #7669 when you have many moving actors causing a lot of shroud changes.

This change reduces repeated work when actor visibilities overlap and when units move. Moving individual units should be slightly less costly in terms of performance now, and moving large groups of units together should be significantly less costly.

This shouldn't affect any in-game functionality - in particular when testing you should verify the radar and the shroud/fog still act correctly.

data.title: Hide faction for players who randomed in diplomacy and objectives panels
data.body:
As requested in  #7391.
Allies will show up as normal, enemy and neutral players will show up as unknown.
I don't consider that issue closed until the UI gets updated with the players' factions once you discover them, but that's a personal opinion. If people say this is enough, then we can close the issue once this is merged.

data.title: Small polish
The uninstaller leaves behind all Start Menu shortcuts
data.body:
```
OpenRA
  OpenRA.lnk
  OpenRA Editor.lnk
  README.lnk
  Uninstall.lnk
```

data.title: Disables WithDeathAnimation for deployed TS units
data.body:
Fixes regression from #7687.
Fixes crash when destroying deployed Tick Tank, Arty, Sensor Array or ICBM launcher.

data.title: Add engine support for features required by a MechCommander-based RTS mod
data.body:
Have always wanted to make one, as I see massive fun-potential in this. 
To my knowledge MechCommander (Gold) is freeware (though not open-source like MechCommander 2, unfortunately), so there shouldn't be any legal issues.

There are several features and fixes required to make this good and keep the amount of work in check (especially on the graphics side). This issue is supposed to keep track of the individual requirements.
- [x] #7717 Make actor height (and Z height for targeting) customisable
- [x] #7716 Add support for SSI shp version 1.10 (assembly outside of OpenRA)
- [ ] #9268 Add support for directional armor
- [x] #7666 Support for using individual files for each frame of a sequence
- [x] #6631 Add SplitFacings option to various Render traits
- [x] #6465 Minor offset issues with barrels, muzzle flashes...
- [x] #6247 Issue with order click area (diamond-shaped cells)
- [x] #3736 Missiles move towards ground before moving towards target
- [x] #9677 Facing reflection/mirroring (required for #3274 as well)
- [x] #7675 Raycast collision detection for projectiles

data.title: Make actor height (and Z height for targeting) customisable
data.body:
Should affect blockable projectiles and possibly flying actors.
Needed for TS (and my MechCommander RTS mod).
- [x] customisable height for blocking actors
- [ ] custom target point ZOffset for projectiles
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/9892042-make-actor-height-and-z-height-for-targeting-customisable?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add support for SSI SHP type 1.10
data.body:
As used in some SSI games and MechCommander 1.
I consider this solved if support for the presumably MC1-exclusive variant - where the first 6 bytes do unknown stuff and the regular header only starts at the 7th byte - is added as well (should be easy since there don't seem to be any other differences).

Source code for SHPEd05 can be found here (old C++ program):
https://github.com/reaperrr/MechComRTS/tree/bleed/docs/shped05-sourcecode

data.title: Only evaluate input sequence once in RandomOrDefault.
data.body:
This ensures non-deterministic sequences cannot crash by returning an empty sequence on the second evaluation.

Fixes #7705.

data.title: Removed legacy ARRAKIS tiles
data.body: Split from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496 as suggested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7714.

data.title: Added a camera icon
data.body: split from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496.

data.title: Fixed spice being drawn above the grid
data.body: split from #4496.

data.title: Fixed the Sietch sprite offset
data.body: split from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496.

data.title: Fix radar origin for non-square widgets.
data.body: #7699 introduces our first rectangular radar bin, which makes the issue obvious.

data.title: Added checks for missing sequence entries
data.body:
Closes #2283.

I experienced two crashes recently: 
- The sietch not having make animations while testing #4496.
- Deployed Tiberian Sun units not having death animations, a regression from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7687.

I extended the rule to also cover sequence definition on the actor from all traits (including overlays) and discovered some more inconsistencies in seldom used units. Also took some effort to clean things up.

data.title: Add a utility command for checking sequences.
data.body:
`--check-sequence-sprites` reports missing sprite errors when parsing sequences.

It requires the assets to be installed to work correctly, so can't be integrated into our automated tests.

This, #7707, and #7700 put the prerequisites in place for finally fixing #5272.

data.title: Automated correctness fixes for tileset definitions.
data.body:
This adds a `--fix-classic-tilesets` utility command that parses the tilesets in a mod and inserts tile definitions that were previously implicit.  It also fixes some missing `PickAny` cases and adds explicit filename extensions for the tile images.  Finally, it enables the per-tile minimap colors that are defined for TS and RA2.

This is part of a larger series of patches (along with #7700 and future prs that build on these two) that fixes #5272.

data.title: Fix for the EnemyWatcher-Disguise trait interaction
data.body:
With the newly added to RA `EnemyWatcher` and `AnnounceOnSeen` traits, a bug was exposed with the RA spies, which resulted in a crash inside `EnemyWatcher`:

> [21:42:38] <John86> https://justpaste.it/k2x2
> [21:42:39]  <orabot> Title: Red Alert Mod at Version {DEV_VERSION} Operating System:... - justpaste.it

This was a result of the questionable way the disguise was removed when the spy attacks.
This is likely not a proper fix, but a bandaid for the hack.
I am doing this so we can get back on the road to a playtest sooner, rather than in a month.

EDIT: It turns out this isn't a problem with undisguising, but with EffectiveOwner in general.

data.title: RandomOrDefault crashes if the collection is empty.
Don't require "LockSpawn" to set "Spawn"
data.body:
```
    PlayerReference@Multi0:
        Name: Multi0
        Playable: True
        Race: Random
        Spawn: 1
        Enemies: Creeps
```

didn't work before, until you added  `LockSpawn: true`.

data.title: Fixed D2k trails and deviator explosion color
data.body:
Uses the correct trail animations for D2k missiles.
Removes contrails.
Makes explosion and trail of Deviator weapon player-colored.

Fixes points 1-3 of #7689.

Requires #7639.

data.title: Fix a crash in UpgradeActorsNear.cs
data.body:
Repo case:
Cloak `gahpad` or `nahpad` with `nastlh`.
Build some units.

data.title: Possible CPos -> MPos conversion miscalculation
data.body:
Something I noticed when testing my `Map.ChooseClosestEdgeCell()` method today:
This line here:  `var mpos = pos.ToMPos(this);` seems to give me a proper X (U) coordinate, but the Y (V) coordinate is off. It seems like it's `Map.Bounds.Top + 2*actual_V_Offset`.
~~You can test this by getting #7664 and running TS on the blank map. I added a way to easily test by issuing Move orders. Such an order will result in calculating the edge cell that is closest to the actor and drawing a target line to it.~~

data.title: Add support for per-sequence animation defaults
data.body: This adds support for a "Defaults" section in each sequence, and removes redundancies from the TS sequences in preparation for tileset-specific artwork.

data.title: Added a new Tiberian Sun mod build palette skin
data.body: This is my proposal for the TS UI.
